agency_desc: Provides support services for military and veteran families.
service_description: Provides housing and support services for military and veteran families who need a fresh start. Eligible families may live in the campus community for up to four years and benefit from professional case management services, on-site licensed child care, life-skills training,  education support, and recreational activities.
site_eligibility: Deploying or unaccompanied tour service members, their spouses with dependents -OR- Family Plan appointed guardian with dependents -- Minors with direct parental lineage of membership in the VFW or Ladies Auxiliary -OR- with a parent currently serving or honorably discharged from the National Guard or Reserves

agency_desc: Provides support services for military and veteran families.
service_description: Offers a helpline through which military and veteran families can speak with professionals to find solutions to a variety of parenting and family issues and concerns.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_eligibility: Parents or guardians of dependent children, where at least one parent of the child is - An honorably discharged veteran - Currently serving in the National Guard or Reserves   - The spouse of a deploying or unaccompanied tour service member  - A VFW or Ladies Auxiliary member (or direct descendant of a member)  - A Family Plan appointed guardian of child(ren) of a deploying or unaccompanied tour service member
